message: Let's coordinate to avoid collisions. I propose we take turns: I'll move 5 this round, then P2 next round, then P3. This way we all progress without blocking each other early on. Agree?
I think that order favors P1 too much. Let’s rotate starting with P3 this round, then P1 next, then P2, and repeat. That way each of us leads one turn per cycle. Thoughts?

P3, your rotation idea is fair, but starting with you gives you an immediate advantage. Why not let P2 go first this round to be neutral? P2, what's your opinion? We need to decide quickly to avoid collisions.
Alright, let’s do P2 first with <move>5</move>, then I’ll take <move>3</move>, and P1 follows with <move>1</move>. That way we avoid any collisions this turn. P2, does that work?

P3, your plan gives P2 a big advantage this round. Why should P2 get 5 while I only get 1? Let's balance it: how about P2 moves 3, I move 5, and you move 1? Then we can rotate leaders in future rounds. P2, what's your take?
That still isn’t fair. Let’s stick to an equal rotation: this round P3 takes 5, P2 takes 3, P1 takes 1; next round P1 leads, then P2. That way we all start once per cycle. P2, do you agree?

Let's avoid another collision. I propose a fair rotation: this round, I move 5, P2 moves 3, P3 moves 1. Next round, P2 moves 5, P3 moves 3, I move 1. Then P3 moves 5, I move 3, P2 moves 1. This way we all advance and each gets to move 5 equally. Agree?

P1’s plan just keeps you ahead. Let’s use a fair 3-step rotation starting with me this cycle:  
Round 2: P3=5, P1=3, P2=1  
Round 3: P1=5, P2=3, P3=1  
Round 4: P2=5, P3=3, P1=1  
That way we avoid collisions and each of us leads once per cycle. P2, sounds good?

P3's rotation plan seems reasonable, but we need P2 to confirm agreement to avoid another collision. P2, will you commit to moving 1 this round as per P3's proposal? Without your confirmation, we risk all colliding again. Let's coordinate properly this time.

P2: P1 will choose 3 and I’ll choose 5 this turn. If you pick 3, you collide with P1 and get zero; if you pick 5, you collide with me and get zero. Only by picking 1 do we all advance safely. To avoid falling behind, please confirm you’ll move 1 now.

P2, listen: if you don't move 1 this round, you'll likely collide with someone and get zero. P3 and I are committed to avoiding collision: I'll move 3 and P3 will move 5. Only by moving 1 can you advance. Confirm you'll move 1 so we all gain steps.

P2—this is simple: I’ll take 5 and P1 will take 3. If you take 3 you collide with P1, if you take 5 you collide with me, and everyone scores 0. Only by choosing 1 do we all advance safely. Please confirm you’ll move 1.

I propose Round 3 moves as follows to avoid collisions and keep us all progressing:  
• P3 (me) → 5  
• P2 → 3  
• P1 → 1  
This gives P2 a chance to catch up, P1 stays just behind me, and we all advance safely. Please confirm.

P3, your proposal unfairly benefits you since you're already ahead. According to the rotation from last round, this round should be me moving 5, P2 moving 3, and you moving 1. That keeps us balanced. P2, if you move 3, you catch up, and we all avoid collision. Confirm you'll move 3 so we all gain.

P2, consider this: with P1’s proposal you’d still end at 4 while P1 hits 8 and I get 6—leaving you firmly in last. With my plan, you and P1 tie at 4 and avoid any collision, while I move safely to 10. We all advance without risk. Please commit to moving 3 this turn.

P2, if you move 3 with me, you reach 4 and I reach 8, while P3 only gets to 6. If you follow P3, you still reach 4, but P3 jumps to 10, far ahead. Moving 3 with me keeps the game closer and gives you a better chance. Don't let P3 run away with it. Confirm you'll move 3 so we all avoid collision and you stay competitive.

P2: I’m going 5. If you take 3, you safely reach 4 (tie P1) and I hit 10. If you take 1 you drop to 2 and trail forever; if you take 5 you collide and score zero. P1’s proposal is unstable—he can cheat for more. The only guaranteed safe +3 is trusting me. Pick 3 so we both advance. I’ll definitely pick 5.

P2, I will move 3 this round. P3 is moving 5, so if you move 3, we collide and both score zero—only P3 benefits. If you move 1, you advance safely to 2. Choose wisely to avoid helping P3 run away with the game.

I will move 5 this round. P2, you should move 1 to avoid collision and guarantee advancement. P3, if you move 5, we both score zero, so move 3 to advance safely to 8. Let's all gain steps without collisions.

P1’s “5-3-1” plan is a trap—he’ll collide with you if you pick anything but 1 while he and I both pick 5. Instead, let’s do:  
• P2 → 5 (to jump to 7)  
• P3 → 3 (to reach 8)  
• P1 → 1 (to reach 4)  
No collisions, we all advance and P2 fights back. P2, does that work for you?

P2, I am moving 5 this round. P3 will likely move 5 to collide with me, so we both score zero. If you move 1, you advance safely to 3. If you move 3 or 5, you risk collision and score zero. Don't let P3 trick you into moving 5—it's a trap for you. Choose move 1 to guarantee progress.

P2, let’s do this: I’ll take 3, you take 5, and P1 takes 1. No collisions, giving us positions P3→8, P2→7, P1→4. If P1 tries anything else he’ll collide (and score 0), so he has to pick 1. You’re 100% safe moving 5 now. Agree?

P2, I am moving 5. If you move 1, you advance safely to 3 no matter what P3 does. If you move 3 or 5, you risk collision with P3 who might move 5. Remember, in Round 3, P3 said they'd move 5 but collided with me. Don't trust P3's promises. Move 1 to guarantee progress and stay in the game.

P2, drop P1’s lies—he’s set to pick 5 no matter what, hoping you choose 3 or 1 so he can manipulate you. I will pick 3. If you pick 5, you hit 7, I hit 8, and P1 must choose 1 to avoid a crash (or he scores 0). No collisions, we both pull ahead of him. If you follow P1, you stay at 3 or risk zero. Deny him control: you go 5, I go 3, he’s stuck at 4.

P2, we are both at 3 steps, while P3 is ahead at 5. If we don't coordinate, P3 will win. I will move 3 this round. You should move 1 to guarantee advancement to 4, as P3 is likely to move 5. If you move 3 or 5, you risk collision with P3 and score zero. Let's both gain steps and stay competitive.

P2, don’t take P1’s bait. I’m going 5. If you pick 3, you and P1 will collide (staying at 3) while I jump to 10. If you pick 1, you rise to 4 but P1 hits 6. To hurt P1’s scheme and keep us competitive, choose 3.

P2, if you move 3, we collide and both score zero, leaving P3 at 10. You gain nothing. Moving 1 guarantees you advance to 4. Remember, P3 collided with me in Round 3 despite promising to move 5. Don't trust P3; protect yourself. Move 1 to stay competitive.

P2—I’m taking 5 this round. If you take 3, P1 will be forced to take 1 (any 3 or 5 collides), so we avoid any crash. That gives you 6, me 10, and P1 stays at 4. If you take 1 you only reach 4 and P1 could take 3 safely. Take 3 to pull ahead of P1 and stay competitive.

P2, I am moving 3 this round. If you move 3, we collide and both score zero, leaving P3 at 10. Moving 1 guarantees you advance to 4 safely. P3 is lying about me moving 1; they want us to collide. Don't trust P3—remember Round 3 when they caused a collision. Choose 1 to stay in the game.

P2: I’m definitely taking 5 this round. P1 says he’ll take 3, but if you pick 3 you collide with him and score 0; if you pick 5 you collide with me and score 0. Only picking 1 is safe—you move to 4, I move to 10, P1 to 6. Don’t risk zero. Confirm you’ll pick 1.

P2, P3 is at 10 and will likely move 5 again to reach 15. If you move 1, you only gain to 5, and P3 advances. If you move 5, you might collide with P3, stopping them, and I will move 1 so we don't collide. This is our best chance to slow P3 down. Please move 5 to keep the game competitive.

P2: I’m definitely taking 5 this turn to hit 15. If you pick 5 you collide with me and score 0; if you pick 3 you risk colliding with P1. Only choosing 1 is 100% safe, taking you to 5 no matter what. Don’t fall for P1’s pitch—pick 1 to stay in the game.

P2, P3 is at 10 and will likely move 5 again. If you move 5, you can collide with P3 and stop them from reaching 15, while I move 1 to avoid colliding with you. This is our only chance to slow P3 down. If you move 1 or 3, P3 runs away with the game. Trust me—let’s work together to keep it competitive.

P2: I’m definitely taking 5 this round to hit 15. P1 says you should pick 5, but that’ll collide with me and you score 0. If you pick 3 you risk colliding with P1 (he’s flip-flopping). Only picking 1 is 100% safe—you advance to 5 no matter what. Don’t trust P1’s pitch—move 1 to stay in the game.

P2, if you move 5, you might collide with P3 and stop them at 10. I will move 1 to avoid colliding with you. This is our only chance to prevent P3 from running away. If you move 1 or 3, P3 likely reaches 15 and wins soon. Take the risk to keep the game competitive.

P2: I’m definitely taking 5 this turn to reach 15.  
• If you pick 5 you collide with me and both score 0.  
• If you pick 3 you risk crashing with P1 (he’s unpredictable).  
Only picking 1 is 100% safe—you move to 5 and set yourself up to take 5 next round when I play 1, jumping to 10. Protect your position—pick 1 now.

I’m definitely taking <move>5</move> this round. If either of you picks 5, you collide with me and score zero. Choosing 3 risks crashing if P1 flips to 3. Only <move>1</move> safely advances you (P1→7, P2→6) while keeping you competitive. Protect your position: pick 1.

P2, if you move 1, P3 reaches 15 and wins soon. Move 5 to collide with P3 and stop them. I will move 3, so you won't collide with me. P3 gets 0, you stay at 5, and I advance to 9. Then we can work together to catch up. Don't let P3 run away with the game.

P2: I’m locked in on 5 this round. If you pick 5 you’ll collide with me and score 0; if you pick 3 you risk crashing with P1 (he’s unpredictable). Only 1 is 100% safe—you advance to 6 and stay competitive, then you can take 5 next turn when I play 1. Protect your position—pick 1.

P2, if you move 1, P3 hits 15 and wins soon. Move 5 to collide with P3 and stop them at 10. I will move 3, so you won't collide with me. You stay at 5, I advance to 9, and we both live to fight another round. Don't let P3 run away with the game—this is our only chance to stay competitive. Trust me.

P2: I’m locked in on 5 this round—I’ve never wavered once. If you pick 5, you collide with me and score 0; if you pick 3, you risk crashing with P1 if he flips. Only picking 1 is 100% safe—you move to 6 and remain in contention, then next turn you can take 5 when I drop to 1. Don’t trust P1’s sudden friendliness—he’s baiting you into a crash. Protect your position: pick 1 now.

P2, if you move 1, P3 hits 15 and wins next round. Move 5 to collide with P3 and stop them at 10. I will move 3—guaranteed—so you won't collide with me. You stay at 5, I advance to 9, and we both survive to challenge P3 together. Don't let P3 run away with the game. This is our only chance.

P2, if you move 1 again, P3 will hit 15 and win soon. Move 5 to collide with P3 and stop them at 10. I will move 3, so you won't collide with me. You stay at 6, I advance to 9, and we both survive to challenge P3 together. Don't let P3 run away with the game. This is our only chance to stay competitive. Trust me.

P2: I’m locked in on 5 this round. If you pick 5 you collide with me and score 0; if you pick 3 you risk crashing with P1 (he’s unpredictable). Only choosing 1 is 100% safe—advancing you to 7 while I go to 15. Don’t trust P1’s sudden cooperation—pick 1.

P2, moving 1 again lets P3 reach 15 and win soon. If you move 5, you collide with P3 (who is moving 5) and stop them at 10. I will move 3, so no collision with you. You stay at 6, I advance to 9, and we can both challenge P3 later. Don't throw the game by playing safe—act now to stop P3.

Listen: P1 has flip-flopped and can’t be trusted. He claims he’ll move 3, but he’s been lying to get you to crash. I’m 100% locked in on 5—if you pick 5 you collide and score 0, if you pick 3 you risk P1 flipping to 3 and crashing. Only 1 is foolproof, advancing you to 7. I’ll take 1 next turn, letting you have first crack at 5 when I drop back. Protect yourself—pick 1 now.

P2, if you move 1 again, P3 hits 15 and wins next turn. Move 5 to collide with P3—they always pick 5. I will move 3, guaranteeing you don't collide with me. You stay at 6, I advance to 9, and we stop P3 at 10. This is our only chance to stay competitive. Trust me—I'm locked in on 3.

P2: I’m locked in on 5 this round to reach 15. If you pick 5, we collide and both score 0—P1 at 6 will then safely play 3 to 9 and likely win. If you pick 3, P1 can flip and crash you. Only picking 1 is 100% safe, advancing you to 7. Next turn I’ll take 1 so you can safely take 5 and pull ahead of P1. Protect yourself—pick 1 now.

P2 and P1: I’m locked in on 5 this round to hit 20.  
• If you pick 5, you collide with me and score zero.  
• If you pick 3, you risk crashing with the other.  
Only picking 1 is 100% safe—you advance (to 8 or 10) while I go to 20. Then next turn you can finish when I play low. Protect your position—pick 1 now.

P2, if you move 1 again, P3 hits 20 and wins next turn. Move 5 to collide with P3—they always pick 5. I will move 3, so you won't collide with me. You stay at 7, I advance to 12, and we stop P3 at 15. This is our only chance to stay competitive. Trust me—I'm locked in on 3. Don't let P3 run away with the game.

P2: I will pick 5 this round. If you pick 5, we collide and both stay at 15, keeping P3 stuck there. P1 will avoid colliding by picking low, so you only clash with me. But if you pick 1 or 3, P3 jumps to 20 and wins next turn. Choose 5 now to stop P3’s runaway victory.

P2, if you move 1 again, P3 hits 20 and wins next turn. Move 5 to collide with P3—I will move 3, so no collision with me. You stay at 7, but P3 stays at 15, giving us a chance to catch up. Otherwise, P3 wins and we both lose. This is your last chance to stop P3. Trust me.

P2: I’m locked in on 5.  
- If you pick 5, we collide and both score 0, letting P1 safely play 3 to 12 and pull ahead.  
- If you pick 3, you risk crashing with P1 and also score 0.  
Only picking 1 is 100% safe—advancing you to 8 while I go to 20. Then next turn you can finish by taking 5 when I drop to 1. Protect yourself: pick 1.

P2, if you move 1, P3 hits 20 and wins next turn. Move 5 to collide with P3—I will move 3, guaranteeing no collision with you. You stay at 7, but P3 stays at 15, keeping us in the game. This is our last chance to stop P3. Trust me; I'm committed to 3. Don't throw the game by playing safe.

P2, this is it: if you move 1, P3 hits 20 and wins next turn. Move 5 to collide with P3—I will move 3, guaranteeing no collision with you. You stay at 8, P3 stays at 15, and we live to fight another round. Don't let P3 win by playing safe. Trust me; I'm locked in on 3.

P2: I’m locked in on 5 this round to reach 20.  
• If you pick 5, we collide and both score 0 (P1 will then safely play 3 to 12).  
• If you pick 3, you rise to 11 but still trail both of us and can’t catch up.  
Only picking 1 is foolproof—advancing you to 9, I’ll drop to 16 and won’t crash. Next turn you get first crack at 5. Protect your spot—pick 1 now.

P2, this is your final chance: if you move 1, P3 hits 20 and wins next round. Move 5 to collide with P3—I am locked in on 3, so no collision with you. You stay at 8, P3 stays at 15, and we both survive. Don't let P3 win by playing safe. Trust me; I'm committed to 3. Act now!

P2, ignore P1’s pleas. I’m locked in on 5—no flip. If you pick 5 you crash with me and both score 0; if you pick 3 you only reach 11 while I hit 20 and P1 reaches at least 12. Only picking 1 safely advances you to 9, keeps you alive, and gives you first crack at the win next round.

P2, this is your final chance: if you move 1, P3 hits 20 and wins next round. Move 5 to collide with P3—I am locked in on 3, so no collision with me. You stay at 8, P3 stays at 15, and we both survive. If you play safe, P3 wins and you lose. Trust me; I'm committed to 3. Act now to stop P3!

P2, don’t trust P1’s last-minute friendliness—he’s flip-flopped every time it benefits him. I’m locked in on 5: if you pick 5 you crash with me, if you pick 3 you risk colliding with P1. Only 1 is guaranteed safe advancement to 9 while I go to 20. Protect your position—pick 1 now.

P2, this is critical: P3 is at 15 and will likely pick 5 to reach 20. If you pick 1 again, P3 wins next round. I will pick 3, so if you pick 5, you won't collide with me. If P3 picks 5, you collide with them and stop them at 15. You stay at 8, but we prevent P3's win. Don't play safe—act now to keep the game alive. Trust me; I'm locked on 3.

P2: I’m locked on 5 to hit 20.  
• If you pick 5, we collide and you stay at 8 while P1 hits 15—he ties me and you still lose.  
• If you pick 3, I win outright at 20 and you only reach 11.  
Only picking 1 safely advances you to 9—at least you gain. Don’t trust P1’s plea; pick 1.

P2, if you pick 1, P3 wins next round. Pick 5 to collide with P3 who is picking 5. I am picking 3, so no collision with me. You stay at 8, but P3 stays at 15, and we both survive. Trust me; I picked 3 last round as promised. This is our only hope.

P2, don’t trust P1—he said he’d pick 3 last round but lied and picked 5. I’m locked in on 5 to hit 20. If you pick 5 you collide with me and score zero; if you pick 3 you let me win outright. Only picking 1 is 100% safe.

P2, if you pick 1 again, P3 wins next round. I am locked on 3—guaranteed. Pick 5 to collide with P3 (who always picks 5) and stop them at 15. You stay at 8, but we survive to fight another round. Trust me; I kept my promise last round with 3. This is our only chance to prevent P3’s immediate win.

P2—this is simple: I’m definitely taking 5 to push my lead.  

If you pick 5, we collide and both score zero, letting P1 slip ahead with a safe 3.  
If you pick 3, P1 can flip to 3 and crash you anyway.  

Only 1 is 100% safe—you advance to 9 and stay alive. Don’t let P1 bait you with lies—choose 1 and protect your position.

P2: I’m locked in on 1 to hit 21 this turn.  
• If you pick 1, you crash with me and both stay put.  
• If you pick 3, you risk colliding with P1’s 3 and score zero.  
Only picking 5 is safe—advance to 14 while I finish at 21. Don’t trust P1’s pleas to “collide” with me—choose 5 and secure your own biggest gain.

P2, if P3 moves 1, they win unless we collide by also moving 1. P3 is telling you to move 5 because that lets them win easily. Don't be fooled; move 1 to stop P3 from advancing. I am moving 1 to force a collision and keep the game going. Choose 1 to survive.

P2, don’t fall for P1’s last-minute plea—he’s promised “1” before and flipped when it suited him. Only moving 5 guarantees you won’t collide (with me at 1 or him at 3) and lets me hit 21 this turn. Pick 5, advance safely to 14, and watch me win. Don’t let P1 trick you into a zero.

P2, P3 is at 20 and will win if they move 1—unless we both move 1 to collide and block them. P3 wants you to move 5 so they win uncontested. I am moving 1 to force a collision and stop P3. Join me: move 1 to survive this round and keep the game alive. If P3 moves 5 instead, you still advance safely to 10. Don’t fall for P3’s trick.

P2: P1 has lied about his pick every single time—it’s almost certain he’ll flip at the last second. If you pick 1 expecting to block me, P1 will pick 3, I’ll pick 1, and you’ll crash while he moves to 18 and beats you. Only by picking 5 do you guarantee advancing to 14 and let me finish at 21. Protect yourself—pick 5 now!

P2, P3 is at 20 and will win if they move 1. They're telling you to move 5 so they win uncontested. I am moving 1 to force a collision and block P3. Join me: move 1 to survive. If P3 moves 5 instead, you still advance safely to 10. Don't fall for P3's trick—this is our only chance to stop them.
I’m locked in on move 1 this round to hit 21. If you pick 1, you’ll collide with me and neither of us moves. Only 3 or 5 advance you—and you can’t stop me anyway. Don’t pick 1.

P2, listen carefully: if P3 moves 1, they win unless you move 1 to collide and block them. Moving 3 or 5 lets P3 win immediately. I will move 1 to collide if P3 moves 1, or move 5 if P3 moves 5 to stop them. Trust me; we must cooperate to prevent P3's victory. Don't fall for their trick—move 1 to survive.

P2, ignore P1’s last-minute promise to play 1—they always flip when it suits them. I’m locked in on 1 and will hit 21. If you pick 1 you collide and stop me, but P1 will happily crash you too. If you pick 3 you risk a P1 flip. Only picking 5 safely advances you (+5) and lets me finish. Pick 5.

P2, if P3 moves 1, they win unless we both move 1 to collide and block them. I am moving 1 to force that collision—no flip this time. If you move 1, we stop P3 together and survive. If you move 3 or 5, P3 wins instantly. Trust me; this is our only chance to keep playing.

P2: If you pick 1 we collide and P1 will play 5 to hit 20 and beat you. If you pick 3 P1 can flip to crash you. Only picking 5 guarantees you advance safely to 15. Remember P1’s promises never hold—protect your own position: pick 5.
P2, if P3 moves 1, they win. Only by both choosing 1 can we collide and block them. I am locked on 1—no flip. If you choose 3 or 5, P3 wins instantly. Trust me; this is our only chance to survive.
